description.narrative: BRA/14/G31 - Develop and demonstrate enhanced, clean conversion technologies for renewable, biomass-based charcoal production, supported by an effective policy framework.
first-order administrative division

A policy framework has been implemented to promote the use of renewable biomassbased charcoal by the IS sector supported by an internationally recognized system for monitoring achieved GHG emission reductions
Acceptable methodologies and criteria to assess charcoal production chains

comment.narrative: No acceptable methodology in place 0

description.narrative: Renewable charcoal strategy in MG

comment.narrative:
No strategy to stimulate charcoal technology development 0
A ban on the use of nonrenewable charcoal is in place in MG forestry law No 1836509
Detailed strategy designed and adopted by MG State Government 1

Political repactuation and commitments of the State of MG with the Project in process of formalization The commitment of MG to e project is one of the strategic aspects of the MoU to be signed between UNDP and the Government of MG for the design of a strategy towards the implementation of the 2030 Agenda
The project was positively welcomed by the private sector steel and iron industry and other stakeholders and potential partners during the inception workshop and first project progress seminar
An analysis of the current institutional and normative framework of the iron and steel sector in Brazil and MG is under development The analysis will subsidize the development of the Sustainable Charcoal Plan

description.narrative: To develop and demonstrate enhanced clean conversion technologies for renewable biomassbased charcoal production supported by an effective policy framework
Investment capital leveraged for efficient charcoal production

comment.narrative:
Due to a restructuring of Fundo Clima which is currently supporting a vast range of initiatives in addition to climate change MMA is renegociating a financing line to support sustainable charcoal initiatives with BNDES Fundo Clima
The Goverment of MG through its state development bank BDMG has recently committed to open a financial line of support focusing on sustainable charcoal production in the second semester of 2016

description.narrative: 1. Renewable charcoal strategy in MG by the end of the project. 2. MRV system for charcoal production and GHG benefits for I&S sector agents by the end of the project. 3. Charcoal technology test program carried out. 4. Consultancies to support project development 5. a) Number of efficient, clean charcoal production facilities in place; (b) Charcoal production per plant (tons/yr); (c) Wood-charcoal conversion rate per plant (%); (d) GHG emission reductions per plant (tons CO2eq/yr).

comment.narrative: 1. No strategy to stimulate charcoal technology development 2. No system in place. 3. Isolated technology development efforts with low sector coordination level. 4. No (0) consultancies. 5. (a) No (0) facilities in place; (b) No production (0 tons/yr); (b) baseline technology conversion rates are 25-30%; (c) No emission reductions (0 ton CO2eq/yr).

1. Sustainable charcoal strategy under development. 2. MRV system launched. 3. Evaluation of fiscal incentives programs hired. 4. Call to disseminate demonstration units/training program launched. 5. Results on business models consultancy published and disseminated. 6. Call to support independent charcoal producers launched. 7. Results payment concluded. 8. Results on best practices consultancy published and disseminated.
1. Sustainable charcoal strategy hired (July/2019) and under development. 2. MRV system tested and additional import/export tools added.
